Fields.DialogueText: Hachi?
Hai!
Is it really all right with you to be called Hachi?
It is who I am, Kanchou.
It just feels so... impersonal.
The Dai-Nippon Teikoku Kaigun - the Imperial Japanese Navy - has seen it proper to name me Number Eight of the Junsen III Type, of the Junsen-Class Submarine family.
Which is why the rest of the crew call you Hachi no Kami.
Hai, Kanchou.
But I shouldn't?
As you are my kanchou and superior it is within your right to refer to me with no honorifics,  Kanchou.
If you say so. Still, just because I can doesn’t mean I should. How does Hachi-san sound instead?
It is your decision, Kanchou. I shall respond to what you call me either way.

Fields.MenuText: You're not making this easy, are you?
It's your decision, too.
Hachi-san it is, then.

Fields.DialogueText: Gomen'nasai gozaimasu, Kanchou. I mean no disrespect.
You are too polite, Kanchou. I would like the -dono honorific one day, but that is a level of respect I have not earned.
Hai, Kanchou.
I'm not sure I agree, but... okay, it's "-san" for now.
@BATTLE
I’ve heard you’re unhappy with several members of the crew.
Certainly not, Kanchou! My crew is loyal, faithful and righteous to a man. To accuse me of being displeased when I’m not is slanderous.
Hold on, Hachi-san. I’ve seen it myself-
Toward the linguistics department.
Oh, those shaggy... They don’t count.
They don’t... what makes you say that? We’re part of a multi-national fleet, Hachi-san. A lot of different languages are in use out here. I don’t even want to think about dialects…
The timely sharing of information is vital. To cover every language that could be thrown at us at any hour, I’ll take all the good multilingual comms we can get.
But Kanchou... they won’t wear the proper uniform.
You mean the Imperial Navy uniform.
Hai, Kanchou. I may be a participant in the International Naval Protection Force, but I am at my core a Kami of an Imperial Japanese vessel.
If they are a part of my crew, it stands that they should wear the uniform of my crew.
I can understand why you feel that way.
Then-
But I also understand why they would balk at the idea.
More to the point, the Imperial Navy has signed on to the League's dress policy. You know as well as I do that everything the linguistics team is wearing is fine under the current regulations.
... Hai.
Besides, most navies take a page from the Royal Navy’s gear - so are they really that different?
Do you know how many buttons are on the trouser flap of the United States Navy? Thirteen! Honestly, if they weren’t so sloppy they wouldn’t need so many spares!
None of those are spares.
... They’re not? But... why do they need so many?

Fields.MenuText: I wonder that myself. A missing button would stand out like a lost tooth... that probably makes an American sailor more conscious about inspection, not less.
Tradition... and symmetry. Someone thought that many was a good idea at one time and it just stuck.
The same reason the world over. To hold their pants up.

Fields.DialogueText: I hadn't thought of it that way.
So, it’s not because of the stripes on their flag?
It's a common myth, but no. The way I hear it, it started with seven and just kept increasing until it got to what we have now.
Is that so...
If they’re so “scruffy,” though, I can see that the new guidelines on facial hair are better enforced. "Beards and mustaches permitted, but should be kept trimmed to-"
That won't be necessary, Kanchou.
But you just said...
I’m... not sure I could tell some of them apart without the differences.
... Get to know your linguists, Hachi-san. They may not be native to you, but they’re still sailors and still your crew. They don’t bite.
... Hai, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
And... time!
That was worse than last time. Store it and prepare to start over.
Here’s where you are. Going over a floatplane?
Hai, Kanchou. This one has been decommissioned, but it is still useful for training exercises.
And it's...
A Watanabe E9W1 Navy Type 96 Small Reconnaissance Seaplane.
That’s quite a mouthful.
Yes, well... I hear one of the Kami of the United States took notice of one of my earlier drills.
Apparently, she referred to it as “Slim” when she recounted her observations later... and the nickname has stuck.
I fail to see why myself.

Fields.MenuText: Who knows? Maybe she was referring to you, since it’s your biplane? If anyone deserves to be called that, it’s you.
I’m sure she didn’t mean any harm.
It’s not something to get worked up over. I’ve heard nastier nicknames personally and some of them were to describe me. Slim is harmless.

Fields.DialogueText: You think so? I suppose that is possible...
If you say so. It is still a level of familiarity I’m not comfortable about fostering, though.
Then I’ll see what I can do.
Hai, Kanchou! I’ll let the matter drop then.
How are the drills, by the way?
Not good, I’m afraid. Disassembly and reassembly times are still easily 20% longer than our targets.
In fairness, the weather isn’t the most cooperative today; the sea is distinctly choppy. And some of our sailors are using less polite adjectives.
Unfortunately, a Funayūrei isn’t going to politely wait until the weather is placid, nor turn her back and look the other other way until we are prepared.
You have a point.
What is it?
Funayūrei.
Drill’s over, then!
@BATTLE
You’re up early, Hachi-san. Or are you up late?
Compared to what, Kanchou?
The sun; it isn’t daybreak yet.
Ah. Then neither; I’m on my own time. Unlike a surface Kami of the Fleet, I spend too much time where light can’t reach me to use the sun as a timepiece.
That makes sense. So twenty-four hours from now, regardless of local time, I’ll find you at sword practice?
If we’re on the surface, hai. But this isn’t sword practice, Kanchou. It’s mental sharpening.
Mental sharpening?
Hai. The Emperor decreed that a sailor should cultivate self-possession and form plans with deliberation.
This exercise is to practice being aware, determining the proper response and carrying it out smoothly and swiftly.

Fields.MenuText: I probably should leave you alone then, and stop being a distraction.
You take your preparation rather seriously, I see.
That’s nice and all, but the chances to use your mental sharpening and swordship together like that are going to be rare. I don’t like free-for-alls, if you read me.

Fields.DialogueText: You don’t have to worry, Kanchou. Distractions happen and I should be prepared for them, too.
Hai. I want to be prepared for anything. I’d never forgive myself if my valor was found lacking.
I don’t like brawls either. If we get in one, it means I wasn’t sharp enough mentally. That said, the need to use my blade may be rare...but not impossible. I like to be prepared.
I want to be ready to defend my Emperor and my home from anything that threatens them... from a Funayūrei submarine to a full-sized Vanity.
With or without a chunk of the Protection Fleet behind you?
If it was in defence of the Empire, it wouldn’t make a difference.
Would that matter to you, Kanchou?
Would you deprive me of a valiant death? A death that those who built me can tell their ancestors about with pride?
Tell you what. If we end up the last line of defense against Morganas somewhere, I’m willing to make one hell of last stand.
Until our backs are to the wall though, let’s try to keep “valiant death” to Plan C, D or E.
@BATTLE
Kanchou! My apologies for being rude, but can we hold this position? Two minutes is all I ask.
Hold? I suppose so, but-
Excuse me, Kanchou.
Arigatō, Kanchou!
So what was that all about?
Lunch preparations, Kanchou.
Okay, you lost me.
I apologize. You’re familiar with sashimi, correct?
You mean the bite-sized slices of raw... ah. I guess you’d have to make a real effort to get fish more fresh than ones you just caught outside your hull.
Hai, Kanchou. The rice should be ready soon so there will be nigiri and norimaki sushi as well.
Do you normally do something like this for your lunch?
Not at all, Kanchou. The tuna I brought in is enough for everyone. Why? Is something wrong?

Fields.MenuText: I hope we’re not relying on you for the bulk of our meals.
It just seems a little extravagant.
You have more important things to do than chase down lunch.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry, Kanchou. I just thought that the more I harvest from the waters, the longer our food supply lasts and the longer I may stretch our patrols. And it is tasty this way, too.
If it took more than the blink of an eye to go from sea to galley, I would agree. I’d like to think my way simplifies things.
If you say so, Kanchou.
Okay. I understand that you like it best that way, but not everyone might find uncooked fish the ideal dish.
Everyone here is a submariner. The definition of daring. The foreigners that much more. Still, all it takes is one or two really bad previous run-ins to make someone gun-shy.
... I suppose more of it could be used to make the miso soup...
Good idea.
@BATTLE
You look lost in thought...
I wish I wasn’t. These aren’t good thoughts.
What seems to be the problem?
You are the problem, Kanchou.
... Or, at least, my current feelings about you are.
Oh?
Kanchou, loyalty is an essential duty for me. Death pales before it. If I die, I die... but if I die for the Emperor, I die satisfied.
You’ve said something like that before, yes.
I know I don’t have much experience and that my superiors do. As fellow, dutiful sailors their orders must be the proper course of action.
Go on...
A ship isn’t supposed to choose her commander.
But I did, and I... I... worry about that.

Fields.MenuText: I may be a bit biased here, but I think you did just fine!
It probably wasn’t an easy decision to make.
Choice or not, you serve under me now, so my orders should be the “proper course of action” for you.

Fields.DialogueText: I don’t know about that.
I wish that had been the case...
That’s the problem.
We’d never met before, and yet I chose you without a second thought. My loyalty belongs to the Emperor, but I also feel the draw of loyalty to you.
And I don’t understand why. Is my loyalty that cheap? Was I under a spell? Am I still? Could you be a yokai or another kami?
The way you think and do things, they’re so... different. And yet I know that even now I would follow any command you gave me.
... Even... even one that set me against my home. And that terrifies me. And makes me feel ashamed that it’s even possible.
How long have you felt this way?
... It wasn’t this bad at the start...
I see. I wish you’d told me sooner.
How? I shouldn’t have second thoughts about a commander to begin with!
Gotcha. Well, since it’s you I’m talking to, Hachi-san, I can’t rule out the supernatural... but the last time I checked I was still human.
Also, since you’re struggling this much about me, your loyalty isn’t easy to come by - so you can put your mind at ease about that.
All right.
As for orders. I don’t know what the future holds, so I can’t promise anything.
That makes me a little relieved, actually. It means you do understand the importance of keeping your word and following through on your commitments.
Good. What I can do is earn the trust and understanding you’ve given me. You need to tell me when I’m not, though, so that we can try to be on the same page.
... I’m not used to criticizing my superiors.
Practice makes perfect, Hachi-san.
@BATTLE
And don't worry, I have thick skin.
Hachi-dono...
Injustice! I’m coming for you too, Funayūrei!
My words are reaching you, Hachi-dono? You don’t know how happy that makes me. Hajimemashite! My name is Injustice. Pleased to meet you!
You’re rather... articulate... for a Morgana.
Oh, some are more and some are less. Some of me are more and some of me are less, even. But me... there isn’t a language I can’t speak.
I know my timing is bad, since you just engaged Fire and all. I’ll take my leave, and visit with you later, but I just wanted to say hello.
You won’t get away, coward!
Coward-? I know Cowardice; I’m not her. I just came to talk and introduce myself, so I will go for now.
No, you won’t...

Fields.MenuText: Hold on, Hachi-san. She came looking for you. That sounds like a trap to me.
Be cautious, Hachi-san. She set herself up with too much distance to be coincidental; she knows what you’re capable of.

Fields.DialogueText: And we know nothing about this version of her. Not a lot of documented "lucid Injustice" sightings in our reports.

Fields.MenuText: Maintain your course, but don’t let her goad you in.

Fields.DialogueText: Not to worry, Kanchou. I won’t let her have her way.
I’m probably not the first Kami she’s faced. I’ll be cautious, Kanchou... but we won’t learn anything about her just sitting here.
Hai!
Judged guilty before I’m even tried, I see. I understand you’re in no mood to talk right now, but I hope you will be later. I’ll see you next time.
It will be no different next time.
That would be fine too.
What?
She just wants you talking, Hachi-san.
... She’s gone.
They're almost in range, Kanchou!
I know. But they're not there yet. Hold fire just a little bit longer...
@BATTLE
I have a bad feeling this isn’t the last we’ve seen of her.
Hachi-dono... Hachi-dono...
Hachi-dono...
Easy, Hachi-san.
I understand, Hachi-dono. I am easily ignored... and don’t have your endurance. But before I go, a warning. Your heading is on course for Asphyxiation’s current position.
She is... brooding after a recent embarrassment, but not so distracted that you should take her lightly.
Why should I believe the words of a Funayūrei?
Hachi-san.
Why indeed? That is why I have no answer. You won’t believe me regardless of what I say. Until later...
I think she's gone. Your orders, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: Injustice is bluffing. Put us on stand-by, though - just in case she tries to double back.
If I thought it would do any good, I’d say full stop and do some laps around your hull until you cool down. Don’t let her get in your head, Hachi-san.
If it’s true, then there’s no love lost between Morganas. If not, then we’ll know for sure what Injustice’s word is worth. Take us down.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai, Kanchou! Go to Standby!
I’ll try harder in the future, Kanchou. She just makes me so frustrated.
Believe me, I’m right there with you.
Hai, Kanchou! Preparing to dive!
@BATTLE
... Wait.
Contact?
Hai.
Interesting.
Kanchou... about our latest orders...
Yes. Quite the odyssey; all the way to Lisbon.
Kanchou, if this is about Injustice...
It's not - it's about negotiating new international supply line systems, hence our soon-to-be-visiting rear admiral. While I don’t mind throwing Injustice off our wake, that’s just an added bonus.
... Really?
Really. Be happy, Hachi-san; this is honestly an honor for you.

Fields.MenuText: Didn’t I hear you say you always wanted to travel?
You were meant to be the flagship of a submarine flotilla; transporting top brass is part of the territory.
Not to worry; we’ll be back to punching holes in Morganas in no time.

Fields.DialogueText: I did say that. I suppose this is one way to see the world...
You’re right!  That is a very important responsibility!
I hope so. While this may be a worthy and honorable mission, I truly would rather be hunting Funayūrei.
Then set course for our rendezvous point. We don’t want to keep our VIP waiting, do we?
Certainly not, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
You don’t look happy, Kanchou.
... We have a new mission.
By your expression, it’s a dangerous one.
The dangerous part is you, I think...
Kanchou?
Our orders are to go north, to London.
Detours are to be expected. If we are needed...
To deliver coffee.
... My apologies, Kanchou. I must have misheard you. I thought you said “to deliver coffee.”
Yes, I did say that. A four gallon barrel of high quality, roasted coffee.
Grown in a neutral country.
I’m not thrilled either. Word is that once we hand it off, the British delegate to Geneva will take it from there.
I understand its... significance.
Sort of. But, Kanchou, why a ship with a Kami? Why me??
This isn’t the first shipment. The first tries were overland, and... well, there’s a war. The latest attempts have been by non-Belle ships. They were attacked by Morganas.
Funayūrei! I see... I can lure her in and surprise her!

Fields.MenuText: We’re actually supposed to slip past her, but I’m more than willing to go to Plan B if we get the chance.
The plan is to avoid her altogether. If we can’t help it we fight of course, but we’ve got a schedule to keep.
Absolutely. Nip this nonsense in the bud and clear the route.

Fields.DialogueText: I hope we get the chance, then!
I’ll do what I can to meet that schedule... the sooner I’m done with this nonsense the better.
Nothing would make me happier, Kanchou!
When do we depart?
@BATTLE
So, Hachi-san, what do you think of London? The docks at least...
I’m hurt. I’m a Kami of the Fleet, here on Protection Force business. Do I really need an escort?
Not really, but just think of it as an honor guard.
Is that what it is?
No. But you're not the only Belle who gets this treatment - don't take it personally.
The coffee was offloaded a little while ago, Kanchou. Our task was completed. If we could just get our orders, I would be as eager to be on my way as they are to see me go.
Point 1: again, it's not about you.
Point 2: there's... been a complication.
We’re waiting on our guest: a watchmaker from the Ministry of Supply. He missed his boat and since we’re here, they tasked us with the transport.
A watchmaker? He doesn’t sound very timely, though...
Sounds like he was ready, but his equipment was delayed.
I see. Well, I guess a quick trip back to Lisbon isn’t unreasonable.
He’s not heading for Lisbon, Hachi-san. We’re bound for New York.
New...!
... If those are our orders, Kanchou.
It’s for testing.
Nani?
Trust me, Hachi-san, I’m feeling your frustration... maybe more, because I'm your captain.
I wouldn’t blame you for thinking that I’m letting your potential be abused and squandered.
That’s... not so.

Fields.MenuText: You’re allowed to be honest. Loyally following orders is one thing; being happy about them is another.
I appreciate your respect, Hachi-san. But it isn’t hard for me to imagine how you feel, since I’m thinking the same thing about my superiors.
You need to work on your sincerity, Hachi-san.

Fields.DialogueText: Loyalty isn’t one thing, Kanchou. It is everything. Without the spirit of grateful service to my home, I am no more than rabble.
What if, in the spirit of service, you aided not just the Imperial Navy, but the Protection Fleet and sailors the world over?
I see. I hope you are setting a proper example for those who serve you, then.
Sorry, Hachi-san... I gave several people an earful before I got a satisfactory answer.
Hai.
Our “watchmaker” specializes in marine chronometers. The plan is to test his latest version on our trip. Accurate chronometers lead to more accurate location coordinates.
When non-Belle ships can be more accurate about where they actually are...
We Kami of the Fleet can find them - and the Funayūrei attacking them - faster.
Right. Which saves us time, when time is precious.
I wish you had said so before. Before the arrival of the Funayūrei, I helped with a lot of research at Yokosuka.
That’s the spirit! Now, as soon as our guest and his gear is aboard and my runner gets back with a little something for you, we should be clear to go.
Something for me, Kanchou?
I thought I’d indulge your sweet tooth-
Kanchou! I don't know who is spreading such-
It’s the best-kept secret in the fleet and the worst-kept secret on your deck, Hachi-san.
Since we’re here, I thought you might like to sample one of the local sweets: jelly babies.
... Are they like jellied eels? Petty Officer Hutchinson from linguistics took several of the crew to an eel-and-pie house...
They’re nothing alike. Jelly babies are soft candies just shaped like little dolls. Did they bring any jellied eel back for you?
Hai. They did.
What did you think?
Tasty. The texture of the gelatin was a pleasant counterbalance to the firm bites of meat.
I'm glad you approved.
Yes.
... It went well with the unadon.
@BATTLE
I feel bad about this.
The state of the chronometer? Don’t. If something is going to break, you want it to break while it can still go back to the drawing board. Which is where our friend is right now...
Already? I’m impressed.
I’m not. He was well prepared...
That doesn’t impress me. But he must have been a sailor at one time though, to be confident enough to put pen to paper in seas like this. So, does this change our orders?
I checked; no change. Our course is still to New York.
... Kanchou, there’s a convoy of ships to the north-east. None of them Kami of the Fleet.
Can we make radio?
Almost in range, Kanchou...
For what it's worth, I think the British are now officially happy we're here.
@BATTLE
Not yet.
Get us close enough and send them a warning... we wrecked Disease and company for now, but that’s no guarantee they’ll stay gone for long.
Hai!
So, what did you think of the jelly babies?
... They went well with tea...

Fields.MenuText: So does hardtack. Maybe if you could give me a hint...
That’s okay. I can’t win them all.
So not one of your favorites.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmmm. Perhaps something more like... scones? Yes, I think that’s what the jams went on...
It wasn’t that they were bad, Kanchou. Just... sticky.
Well... not exactly, Kanchou.
*BOOM*
What the...?
It’s from the convoy! Why-
You don’t have the deck of a surface ship, so they know you’re a sub. A really big sub. Looks like they decided to shoot first and apologize later... return to course!
Hai.
Don’t take it personally, Hachi-san. Under better conditions they would’ve seen our markings and had no problems.
... Hai, Kanchou.
Hachi-dono... Hachi-dono...
We have their position, Kanchou.
... You don't sound totally convinced.
I am! I just... I'm not sure if this is all of them.
One problem at a time, Hachi-san.
@BATTLE
Fantastic. Can we get a position on her?
*frustrated shrug*
I hear you have been very busy, Hachi-dono. Disease and Avarice’s wailings were informative... and amusing.
If you'd like to come a little closer, we're ready to spread the amusement around.
I’m hoping that now that you’ve gotten used to me you’ll talk... I am a good listener, Hachi-dono...
Begone, Funayūrei!
You can still speak to me! That’s a relief... I was worried the oni on your deck had sealed away your voice with a command.
But I won’t leave, Hachi-dono. I don’t want to. Besides, while I’m in your shadow you know exactly where I am. I’m not elsewhere, making mayhem and mischief. Isn’t that nice?
Yes. Nice and predictable - which makes you target practice for every other Belle out here. So go ahead; stick around.
I weep for you, Hachi-dono. That your smug little demon has so much power over you.
That’s my Kanchou you’re insulting, Funayūrei.
So it is. How safe it must feel, hiding behind your loyalty and duty. But for how long will it shackle you? How long will you let it shackle you?
... Hachi-san. Take a breath.
It even tells you when to breathe? Oh, Hachi-dono.
Still, it seems I have pushed you too far today, so I will retire. I look forward to the day you come to me, Hachi-dono. To the fire in your eyes.
Hold still and that day can be today!
Not yet, Hachi-dono. Not yet...
*static*
... Kanchou. You’d never... permanently silence me with a command, would you?
I'm going to get sick of that pretty quickly.
The way she described?

Fields.MenuText: She must have really got to you. Not to worry; of course I wouldn't.
I’m not dumb enough to do something like that. Communication is essential and I’m not a mind reader.
Wow. I hadn't even realized that was an option.

Fields.DialogueText: ... It is, Kanchou.
No, Hachi-san. It's not. I was being facetious.
Of course. It was rude of me to even worry about it. Forgive my lack of trust in my superior officer.
You’re fine, Hachi-san.
Neither am I. You’re right: communication is essential. I won’t forget that.
Increase our speed. For now, the more distance we can put between us and her, the better.
Hai!
Well, what do you think of New York, Hachi-san?
... Tall. Skyscraper certainly describes them, now that I’ve seen some.
Yeah.
... And noisy, dirty and smelly.

Fields.MenuText: I'm just going to take a moment to imagine what Recruit would say to that.
I think all of that comes with being a city, Hachi-san.

Fields.DialogueText: Seriously, I think it just comes with being a city, Hachi-san.
I think so too. I want to say that Tokyo and Osaka are not like that at all, but that would be a lie.
My home has less of those things, though.

Fields.MenuText: Sounds like someone is homesick.
I think everyone has a soft spot for home. And New York may be all those things, but you might be a little harder on the place than it deserves.
You see your home through sakura-colored glasses, if you ask me.

Fields.DialogueText: Whether or not I’m homesick, this place is still noisy, dirty and smelly.
Perhaps. But I still know where my heart lies, and it is not here.
You may be seeing home sooner than you think.
What do you mean?
We’ve got our next set of orders. First, we take on quinine and head for Panama, with all haste.
A malaria outbreak... hai. Time will be crucial. But there’s more?
Yes. Once we’re there, we’re to pick up some Morgana-attack survivors and return them home to Japan.
... I see.
I thought you’d be more happy about that.
It won’t be a pleasant trip.
@BATTLE
Hachi-dono... Hachi-dono...
I found you, Hachi-dono...
Like a bad penny.
You still have your oni, I see. A noisy one. Is that why you keep it? Is the sound pleasant to you?
You’ll get nothing from me, Funayūrei.
You’re wrong about that, Hachi-dono. I get much out of our encounters.
Such as...
Are you curious?
That’s fine. I’m curious about you, too. What your world looks like.
My world?
Below the surface. For me, the underside of the waves is not a view I want. That is death. But you... you sink... you die... and then, you surface again! You come back to life!
You do it over and over... just thinking about it gives me shivers!
So, why are you chasing a Belle for answers? Wouldn’t a Morgana sub be easier to ask - or do they want to shoot you on sight, too?
Unlike your little oni, Hachi-dono, those don’t talk much. Or talk well. But you can, Hachi-dono.
You can tell me what it’s like to be dead and look up at the bellies of the living. Do they tempt you, Hachi-dono?
You’re disgusting.
I am? You are a weapon of war, Hachi-dono. Your whole reason to be is to stealthily put short spears below the the belt, am I right?
We could give you a personal demonstration.
I’ve kept you long enough, Hachi-dono. You have promises to keep...
*static*
... And miles to go before you sleep...
And miles to go before I sleep...

Fields.MenuText: I know Justice can be poetic, but Injustice...?
That goes for us all.
So before then look alive, Hachi-san.

Fields.DialogueText: @BATTLE
You were right, Hachi-san. This has been a somber trip.
It’s even worse than I thought. Have you spoken to them?
The people we've rescued? Very little. I wanted to give them their space. Why, have you?
Hai. It was Injustice.
You’re sure of that? I didn’t think they got the chance to see the Morgana.
Absolutely, Kanchou. It’s true they never saw her, but... the cargo ship they were working on wasn’t one of ours. They wanted to see the world, so they were working their way.
Going from ship to ship and being hired on together? Doesn’t sound like a bad way to go abroad... at least until recently.
They said that after the Funayūrei’s mist engulfed the ship, a voice in our language asked if anyone understood her.

Fields.MenuText: ... And they said yes.
I can see where this is going. Damn.
Go on.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai.
Hai.
She then announced in several languages that if all the crew from the Land of the Rising Sun were put off the ship in a lifeboat the vessel would be spared.
... She didn't specify which vessel.
They would have gone willingly but the crew threw them off without a second thought to save themselves.
And in so doing sealed their own doom.
... She wasn’t finished.
There's more?
Hai. After the screaming from the ship’s crew stopped, they heard the voice again. She told them they had too many and had to give one back.
How many were there?
Four, all brothers or cousins. The oldest took responsibility and jumped out.
... They lost sight of him in the mist and never heard from him again.
Yeah, that does sound like her.
@BATTLE
Hachi-dono... Did you receive my present, Hachi-dono?
You did all that... to those sailors... for me?!
That surprises you? I guess I could say yes to that, but... it’s more like because of you, though.
What the hell does that mean?
You still have the squeaky oni, I see...
Answer the question, Funayūrei.
I suppose I can’t fault you for keeping it. I don’t understand your sentimentality to that particular one, though.
Maybe if I traded you for it-
Answer. The question. NOW!
The fire is coming to your eyes, Hachi. The seas don’t belong to the little parasites that infest your hull. The seas belong to you and I.
Those who trespass are subject to our whims. To my whims. So I shake the jar to see the crickets fight.
Do not lump us together, Funayūrei!
I didn’t think to look for ones from the land where the mysterious workings of language bring bliss anywhere but in their territory. But you have traveled far from that place.
And if you can...
You're insane.
Such a silly little oni you have, Hachi. Of course I’m sane. The insane can’t be tried in court.
Injustice is brought before Justice while she dithers over letters in law books and looks for someone to blame for bad things.
... Unless the blind sloth takes matters into her own hands. But that’s just my reflection in the water.

Fields.MenuText: You sound plenty crazy to me.
If you aren’t crazy, then you’re evil.
So I’ll add "lawyer" to your already long list of offenses.

Fields.DialogueText: Crazy is in the eye of the beholder, I suppose.
So, if order or chaos won’t define it, paint it in the black-and-white labels of good versus evil. Typical.
Amusing little oni. You need to train it better though, Hachi; it takes far more than that to sway my emotions. You, on the other hand...
Just to let you know, Hachi, I’ve left you another gift nearby.
I felt like a change of pace and gave no warning. It flopped over quietly... I doubt even you heard it this close. That one is mostly intact, too.
It won’t stay that way long though. It’s too tempting for my sisters to ignore. Ah! There! Can you feel her?
... Destruction!
Yes. She’ll circle... but not for long. Go ahead, Hachi. Tell her I said hello.
@BATTLE
*gasp*
That was quite the dive. If you ever threaten to hold your breath, remind me to give in right away.
The narrator that normally comes to the dock when you’re home said you hadn’t come to see his kamishibai performance.
I know the pace has been rather hectic for a while...
The pace isn’t the issue, Kanchou. I’m ready to leave in a heartbeat. What I’m feeling right now is that I’m being punished.
I understand. But in light of what Injustice has said and done, you’re a target. And now that she’s made it clear the lengths she’ll go-
I’m not allowed out by myself.
That’s a surly way to put it.
But it’s the truth! I’m supposed to be an independent scout; other Kami of the fleet shouldn’t have to look out for me! I shouldn’t... need... babysitters.
Is that what you believe? You don’t sound very convincing.
Of course I do!
So, the next time you see Injustice again... what happens?
Okay, let me rephrase that: what do you want to happen?
I want her caught... I want to catch her.
How? Have you examined that scenario in one of your mental sharpening drills?
... We’ve been so busy, I haven’t had a chance to practice in a while. Let me think about that...
I’m sorry to press you for time, Hachi-san...
You mean...!
Our orders are to make a medical supply run to Singapore then make all haste to the League HQ in Lisbon. They want to know everything we know about Injustice.
Without escort? Alone?
Apart from our own regular battle group, yeah. That’s the plan. Think you’ll be prepared?
I should be. But... it would be helpful if I could practice first.
Two can play at Injustice’s game, Hachi-san. I bet the other Belles in port have seen a Morgana or two recently that you could practice on. Just get a rough location and we’re good to go.
I’m not sure how much help I may receive, Kanchou. I’ve been rather cross and... anti-social... to the other Kami of the Fleet.

Fields.MenuText: Everyone has an off day or two. And who can stay mad if you bring along a few snacks...
I’m sure they’ve heard about Injustice already and will easily accept your apology.
We’re all professionals here; they’ll recognise helping you out helps them too. Just say you’re sorry and move on.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai! I’ll make a quick shopping list...
That’s true: I couldn’t put a lid on it if I tried.
You’re right, Kanchou! The other Kami should be very understanding and if I make sure to apologize properly it should be all right.
I’ll get you an errand runner right now.
Kanchou, arigatō! I’ll be ready... I swear it!
@BATTLE
Hachi... Hachi...
Where are you, Hachi?
A little bird told me you’ve been practicing...
*quiet gesture, fingertip to lips*
You’re learning. You’re growing.
Is there enough fire in your eyes yet? Come out and show me, Hachi...
Are you asleep in death, Hachi? You must be... you must be. You need to live. You need to THERE YOU ARE!
Ah, hell. Hachi-san, we've been marked - what are we up against?
Mischief group, Kanchou! I can feel Injustice, too - the chatty Injustice - she's closer than usual...
You are good.
One thing at a time! Close with Mischief - but keep an eye on Injustice!
And good is no good, Hachi. The fire will die in your eyes and they’ll go filmy and glassy. I want to see the fire still in your eyes after they become filmy and glassy.
This one really likes to hear herself talk...
@BATTLE
Kanchou, the Mischief group is clear!
What's the status of our obsessive Injustice?
Still at distance, Kanchou - I think she's taken some propeller damage! She has reinforcements incoming, but if we-
No. Submerge and withdraw.
... Hai.
Hachi-san. Don't just glower. You can speak your mind while you're following orders.
... What if I could have finished her, Kanchou?
We were in a kill box. It's only because of disorganization on their side that we're making it out without being hammered by Mischief's group on one side and Injustice's on the other.
But I could have finished her! I'm sure of it!

Fields.MenuText: Sure. But I don't want you to.
I’m glad you’re fired up, but you can only say that in hindsight. There were too many variables before.
No, you couldn’t. She wanted you to come to her, remember? Staying after the element of surprise wore off would have been foolish.

Fields.DialogueText: Nani? I don't follow your logic, Kanchou.
... I suppose you have a point. But what now?
But she will be on her guard the next time. The element of surprise will wear off even faster. I’ll never get another chance like that, Kanchou.
No, you won’t. You’ll get one even better.
How do you figure?
She said it before. She listens to other Morganas. She found you quickly because she didn’t need to cast her net that wide.
This time she has all the information we’re going to give her.
You have an plan?
Yeah. I’ll explain on the way. For now, give me all the speed you can to Singapore and prepare for a quick turn-around.
Hai!
I don't like it.
I know. But if it works, we’ll keep her busy.
How busy?

Fields.MenuText: Too busy checking her empty net to catch us.
Too busy to prey on the unwary.
Busy enough.

Fields.DialogueText: I hope so.
So you say. Still... can I hope that she preys on other Funayūrei in her hunt for my location?
Two birds with one stone? You bet, Hachi-san. Think positive!
IF it works, Kanchou.
Still... why Colombo?
To force her to cast her net as wide as possible. She knows how far you can go, but not where or why. From Colombo you could literally be headed anywhere.
Meaning she has to look for me everywhere. I’m still unconvinced that it will prevent her from shattering every ship that she can get her claws on, out of frustration and spite.
There’s a risk of that, yes. But that both slows her down and leaves a trail for a nice, speedy Belle to track her. She’s smart enough to know about both.
And the other Funayūrei?
Before Colombo, they light our trail. After a circle of Ceylon, to point us in any direction... our trail needs to disappear, Hachi-san.
Then until that time, Kanchou, I will kindle a bonfire.
@BATTLE
Kanchou...
I see them. Looks like our fire metaphor may be getting a bit more literal than I'd expected.
@BATTLE
... Hachi-san?
Yes, Kanchou?
I have a confession to make.
What's that?
I hate mines.
I understand, Kanchou. I’m allergic to them myself.
I blame myself for this. I was warned Ceylon had a few mines around. I didn’t realize they meant a field this thick around the whole damn island...
The Funayūrei have been here more than once or twice. I think it should be larger, personally.
This would be a bad enough during the day. With nightfall... not a chance.
I could swim out and personally deal with them...
You could, but if a Morgana shows up while we were in the middle of it, we’d be sitting ducks. And we’d have the same problem on the way out.

Fields.MenuText: What fuel we have is more than enough to keep Injustice guessing. We’re still good.
Maybe this is for the best. The longer we stay the more danger we put this place in.
Topping off our tanks isn’t worth this risk.

Fields.DialogueText: Full fuel tanks may not be necessary, but they would make that Funayūrei guess more.
This place is in harm’s way whether we are here or not. They wouldn’t have the mines otherwise.
Yes, but I feel like I’m losing to it.
In a perfect world, an observer in a scout plane could find a path through it, but with dusk...
Hachi-san! Good work!
... Thank you, Kanchou, but I just said it wouldn’t help.
We can't get a map of the field, no. But I bet one of the ships in that harbor can spare a plane to fly us out a harbor pilot if we can get it organized in time.
... I'll meet you in the radio room.
Feeling better?
Hush, Kanchou. Mines have a nasty habit of slipping their chains and roaming free. Until I have more distance between my hull and that mine field...

Fields.MenuText: Don't tempt fate. Got it.
I should know better than that. Sorry.
As you were, then.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai!
Thank you for your understanding.
It is nothing to apologize for, Kanchou.
Are you comfortable picking up speed? It's taken us longer than I'd hoped.
I know the feeling, Kanchou. And, yes, it should be safe enough...
I hate to say it, but: it's a shame the skies are so clear. I'd just as soon the enemy's scouting abilities were down for a day or two.
Gomen, Kanchou. Word from the port authority was that...
... Kanchou! There’s a mist forming! It’s her!
Where?
Multiple points, Kanchou! She's to the east, but there's a group southeast coming at greater speed...
Hachi... Hachi... Come out come out, Hachi...
Too fast for us to escape?
No, Kanchou.
Right. Then there's no need to fight above our weight when hunger might send them right into a minefield. We proceed with our plan - get us some distance, Hachi-san.
... Hai, Kanchou.
We made it to the Red Sea. We should be clear here.
I don’t want clear, Kanchou. I want free. I want to be free of her. I want her.
I want to drive a spike through her skull, and gut her like a yellowfin!
... And serve her head on a platter with tastefully arranged choice cuts?
Kanchou! What are you saying?

Fields.MenuText: Oh good, it seems that there are mental lines you still haven’t crossed yet... unless you’re going to tell me that Morgana is supposed to be served over a bowl of rice instead of a platter...
That’s my line, Hachi-san. Are you really comparing killing a Morgana to catching food?
You tell me.

Fields.DialogueText: No. Of course not.
I... didn't mean literally.
I didn’t mean that I really would eat her.
No, only that she deserves no better than to be treated like food.
Look, I get that she has you frustrated.
Why shouldn't I be? She keeps finding me. Following me, just out of reach. Driving me. The rest of the Fleet knows where I am and she still slips away from every trap.
And my valor...
There are only two ways out of this sea: the way we came in, and the Suez Canal. Tell me, Kanchou... is my back far enough to the wall yet?
What do you think?
Why? Does it matter?
Absolutely. I could command you to flap your arms and go to the moon, but if you believe there’s no way you can do that, no orders will make it happen.
But I could do that.
If the sun can be pierced with an arrow shot at its reflection, I can certainly swim to the moon in still waters.
That’s exactly my point. So, do you believe we're just running until she kills us? Or do you believe Injustice has you right where *you* want *her*?
But... if she remains out of my range...
She wouldn’t be if she couldn’t find you - and that’s our problem to solve, not hers.
Do you think we can? Before she comes?
I know we can. What do you say?
For victory, I pledged, and gallantly left the country. Without exploits, I can’t die...
Kanchou, consider me immortal.
@BATTLE
Hachi... Hachi... Already submerged, hiding in the Land of the Dead. You choose a small area to play in, though... the fire in your eyes must be blinding.
Or is it because you're tired of saving the sailor-lice I leave in my wake? I wouldn't blame you.
*whispering* Careful. She wants to provoke us.
This bathtub of a body of water, this Red Sea... Hachi, you choose a most poetic location. I approve. Lady Báthory would be proud.
A fascinating series of questions. Thank you, Hachi... finding the answer should be a good way to pass the time.
*whispering* Not now, not ever.
*whispering* We're getting closer! Ssh!
I think I’ll start with yours, Hachi. It has too much power over you.
... Though, now that I think about it, your oni is quiet.
Did it abandon you? I can’t imagine it staying so well-behaved for this long otherwise. Such a sad fate, Hachi.
*whispering* Kanchou...
*whispering* Hold your fire. I want to be able to count the barnacles on her draft.
You’ve become good at this game. And I don’t mind. It shows how much spirit is in you, how much fire and power you already come to the table with.
But you are too shy. Come out, come out, Hachi. So we can talk. Or, if you prefer, there are other games besides Hide and Seek and Tag that we could play.

Fields.MenuText: *whispering* Yeah. Doctor. ...Frankenstein, that is...
*whispering* Like the Most Dangerous Game...
*whispering* We’re not done playing this one yet.

Fields.DialogueText: Ssssshhhh!
Just know this, Hachi. You have only made yourself more fascinating to me, not less. And I will follow you to the ends of the earth to play...
*whispering* I see 16 per square centimeter.
Fire torpedoes!
*whispering* We know how she wants this to go. She watches from a distance as we fight other Morgana groups.
*whispering* Kanchou. I know the plan. Her allies...
*whispering* If that's the word.
*whispering*... are closing in on the rest of our group. She's alone.
*whispering* Kanchou? Should I know who that is?
*whispering* Renaissance-era Hungarian noblewoman with some very bad habits. Not immediately relevant.
*BOOM*
What's her status?
One moment, Kanchou...
Broadcast signals are gone! Catastrophic hull breach! And she's turning much too hard for a center of gravity like hers... I think she's capsizing, Kanchou!
Is she already dead, or do we need to put her out of her misery?
I don't think she's conscious, Kanchou. It's just reflex now...
Okay. Our priority now is helping our friends with the rest of the battle group. We can come back for her later if she isn't already under.
Hai!
@BATTLE
Kanchou? It's done.
Get the fires out as quickly as possible - we need visibility! Does anyone have eyes on Injustice?
... Just debris, Kanchou. And I don't sense her. I think she's gone.
... Here's hoping.

Fields.MenuText: I’m not happy that a Morgana thinks she’s got the right to use no honorifics with you when I still do. I plan to call you just Hachi from here on out, if that’s all right with you.
I’ve been thinking that -san may be a little too formal. Do you mind me calling you Hachi-chan, instead?

Fields.DialogueText: We can’t even get out of the Suez without a mission. “Detour to Naples?” All because we’re just passing through?
It can’t be helped. Although transporting an Ammiraglio d'Armata to Lisbon...
I get a sense of deja vu myself, Hachi-san. I guess I’ll just look on the bright side.
Bright side?
You were getting worried, weren’t you? That because of Injustice you were going to get docked. Or at the very least, no one would trust you with important missions anymore.
This proves that's not the case.
I see.
Steel yourself, though. We’re in for the debriefing of our lives when we get to Lisbon.
Not to worry, Kanchou. I will do my best to be a proper representative of my Emperor and home.
I know you will. You always do. So, any thoughts about what to do after they cut us loose?
I didn’t think we had a choice in the matter, and would return to our regular patrol.
Probably. Still, I’m curious if you’re traveled out, or if you want to return to our usual haunts by way of another mission or two.
What do you think?

Fields.MenuText: No fair. I asked you first.

Fields.DialogueText: So you did. It is true that we spent very little time in port...

Fields.MenuText: If you want my input, well... missions are never sightseeing tours, but I see no reason why we can’t be more... helpful on our way back.

Fields.DialogueText: I see. I do like to be helpful...

Fields.MenuText: We’ve been gone longer than planned; if we’re absolutely needed back they won’t give us a choice. If they do, though...

Fields.DialogueText: I wouldn’t mind. The more unpredictable I can be the better, I think.
... I have heard the Southern Cross is nice this time of year...
@BATTLE
We're clear, Kanchou.
We're not clear until the paperwork is done. But I take your point, Hachi-san.
Kanchou?
That's fine, Kanchou. The "-san" was your idea to begin with, as I recall.
Sometimes my brilliant ideas are superseded by even more brilliant ideas.
Ah.
